description: Chefs weave South Korean culinary tradition with European techniques, elevating classics such as juk, japchae and kimchi. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Beyond kimchi: South Korean food gets luxe update at these Seoul restaurants
title_page: Beyond kimchi: South Korean food gets luxe update at these Seoul restaurants | The Straits Times
maintext:
SEOUL – Most guidebooks on Seoul describe a city of contradictions. Entwined in the labyrinth of skyscrapers and high-rise luxury hotels are pockets of tradition and nature.
A stone’s throw from the Gangnam branch of Lotte Department Store lie the serene gardens of Buddhist temple Bongeunsa. Walk a few metres past the business district of Jongno-gu to revel in Seoul’s premier palace, Gyeongbokgung, or the grand Deoksugung Palace, which dates back to the Joseon Dynasty (1392 to 1910).
